column4: hi can you guys help me? I'm trying to install the fglrx drivers on this system (I'm on it now) but everytime I install them X crashes upon booting, and I have to remove them using sudo apt-get remove fglrx* before I can reboot my system again...
I'm also not able to install the driver using the Restricted Drivers Manager, but I have been able to before on the same system in the past.
tanner -- try with sudo cp
or maybe use sudo nautilus if you need to use the gui
anyone there that can help me with my graphic driver problem?
tanner -- open terminal, and type sudo nautilus, press enter. you should have root permissions in the windows that pops up;
irssi is much better than pidgin IMHO
I need to get proprietary ATI drivers to work with my card.
They used to work in the past, but they stopped working after updating and installing software, and I need to get this fixed.
whats your card modeL ?
& i assume your using Jaunty ??
Will propreitary drivers not load ?
-- proprietary drivers wont load anymore... after I installed a lot of packages and updated the system...
Did the updates include a kernel package??
-- I updated the kernel, yeah.
I usually get problems with drivers and settings ALOT when upgrade to newr kernel.. etc.
So did it happen after installing updateing kernel ?
Hmm.. do you still have outdated kernel in your grub boot up list ?
If so try booting up with outdated kernel and see if it works fine, then you know the cause of it anyways...
-- i'm gonna reinstall the driver and try old kernel...
